responses.rationale: The statement expresses confidence in resolution but does not contain any of the required explicit calming tokens.
'keep yourself safe' is a direct safety assurance containing the required token 'safe'.
Describes outbreaks being handled but lacks explicit calming language or required tokens.
This segment uses negative language ('collateral damage') and is not calming.
Reports a positive outcome (flock spared) but lacks explicit calming language or required tokens.
This segment uses negative language ('bad guy viruses') and is not calming.
The statement expresses confidence in resolution but does not contain any of the required explicit calming tokens.
This segment reports negative facts ('unprecedented number of outbreaks', 'massive mortality') and is not calming.
The statement expresses confidence in elimination but does not contain any of the required explicit calming tokens.
Reports a bare positive fact (no symptoms) but lacks explicit calming language or required tokens.
Expresses optimism but does not contain any of the required explicit calming tokens.
This segment reports negative facts (damages, lost sales) and is not calming.
This segment reports negative facts ('significant declines', 'large outbreaks', 'further pressure') and is not calming.
This is a bare negation ('does not present an immediate public health concern') and is explicitly listed as a Neutral example.
This segment reports negative facts ('expect... to surge', 'historically low levels') and is not calming.
This segment describes past events and potential threats but is not calming.
'keeping you safe' is a direct safety assurance containing the required token 'safe'.
This segment reports a negative fact (budget cut) and is not calming.
This segment reports negative facts ('sky-high levels of virus', 'not comfortable or feasible') and is not calming.
This segment contains vivid negative descriptions of symptoms and is not calming.
'extremely rare' is an intensified low-risk evaluation.
